Type.Name: DefaultMemberAttribute

TypeSignature.Value: .class public sealed serializable DefaultMemberAttribute extends System.Attribute
.class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit DefaultMemberAttribute extends System.Attribute

Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

remarks.para: A property is imported as an indexer (default indexed property in Visual Basic) if the property has arguments and if the name of the property or one of its accessors matches the name specified by the . If the is not present on the containing type, then the type does not have an indexer. The C# compiler emits the on any type containing an indexer. In C# it is an error to manually attribute a type with the if the type also declares an indexer.

summary.para: Defines the member of a type that is the default member used by .

MemberSignature.Value: public rtspecialname specialname instance void .ctor(string memberName)
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string memberName) cil managed

remarks.para: This constructor initializes the property using .

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Docs.param: A String containing the name of the member to invoke. This may be a constructor, method, property, or field. A suitable invocation attribute must be specified when the member is invoked. The default member of a class can be specified by passing an empty String as the name of the member.

MemberSignature.Value: .property string MemberName { public hidebysig specialname instance string get_MemberName() }

value.para: A representing the member name contained by the current instance.

remarks.para: There is no set accessor because the name must be provided to the constructor. The name is not optional.

summary.para: Gets the name from the attribute.
